website_summaries.verdict: The best budget mountain bike inner tube with one of the widest ranges of sizes available.
pros: Comes in many different tire sizes, including common larger mountain bike sizes such as 27.5 and 29 inches
Offers both presta and schrader valves to match your personal bike bump without the need for an adapter
cons: Bike tubes can pop off the rim if the rim/tube size ratio is mismatched

customer_reviews.title: Defective product
customer_reviews.text: 5 out of the last 6 tubes that I have purchased have split on the inside of the tube. These small splits have occurred on the seam of the tire-which to me points to a cheaply made, not durable product. These holes do not occur on the outside, where a thorn, nail, or other outside force could puncture, but on the inside. After the first hole I thoroughly inspected my rim to see if there was something there to cause it, but it appears to be defective tubes. I install these tubes according to manufacturer’s specs and pressures and the problem continues to happen. I am extremely disappointed in this product and am not satisfied with my purchases.
customer_reviews.author: The Judge

customer_reviews.title: No option to choose the right stem length for my tire size, but they work well nonetheless
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately there wasn't an option for choosing 700 x 20-25cc 42mm valve stems; ended up receiving 60mm valve stems despite needing 42mm. I suppose it's better than receiving 42mm valve stems and needing 60mm. Running around looking a bit goofy, but won't knock it any stars for that as the product functions just fine. I've not had a chance to ride long distance with these (rode approximately 100 miles so far over the course of the last few days), but Continental's track record has been good as a whole so I'm confident that if they didn't blow up within the first 100 miles that they're good.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Embry

customer_reviews.title: Hit and miss
customer_reviews.text: I have bought probably around 10 of these and around half of them work perfectly but the other half doesn't hold air. Some of them will hold air for a week and others will lose the air within a few hours. The tubes that lose the air aren't old, punctured, or anything; I will put the bad tubes in water to see where a hole is but can't find one so I assume it is due to the stems. They are a good cheap tube but not one I would recommend for people who go through tubes often since it seems you are always pumping it up.
customer_reviews.author: cal

customer_reviews.title: All 3 of these tubes failed on me...
customer_reviews.text: .. and all in the same way. The "removable" core in all 3 valves was happy to be removed no matter what presta pump I used. The first instance left me stranded on the side of the road because the valve core was wedged into my adapter. I bought a new pump to avoid the adapter issue and even used small pliers to tighten the core before installation. But the core gets stuck in the new pump too; when you detach the pump, the core comes with it. I thought paying extra for Continental tubes would be a smart investment, but it just lead to me paying more for garbage.
customer_reviews.author: NorCal DC

customer_reviews.title: Don't purchase!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this tube as a backup to a much more expensive flat resistant tube also purchased from Amazon. The flat resistant tube lasted 2 miles when it went flat from a manufacturing defect whereby the valve base separated from the tube. This tube had more holes in it than I had patches, right out of the box. All holes were similar (there were three small parallel slices in the side of the tube) so we had two failures in less than 15 minutes of riding...and a ruined afternoon at Lake Tahoe... Note to self: Inflate all tubes and (especially!) spares prior to use to make sure they're not defective out of the box!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality Junk
customer_reviews.text: POOR Quality! failed at the seam 20 miles into first ride. Can’t believe these are genuine Continental or they have major quality issues. Like many others stated these are MADE IN CHINA.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't repair what came broken
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed that there is a major hole in the seam. I was going to patch it up and not even do a review. But after I sanded it and went to put glue on i became quite frustrated that I couldn't finish the job because I am out of glue. My son threw away the box a while ago so I am hoping amazon will still accept the return. I am rating this a 1 star to show that the quality control of the product needs to be improved. I like to give positive reviews but when I can't use the product at all then it warrants the rating. Please like this review if it is helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Scott K

customer_reviews.title: not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: the tubes are clearly stated to be seamless. The ones I received had three seams around the entire tube plus numerous cross seams. Seams get in the way of good patchwork. I specifically bought these tubes for that feature. Lovely boc full of German words and then made in China. They're no better than tubes I paid about half the price. They are also 35 grams heavier that Performance tubes.
customer_reviews.author: Ed P

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 tubes and worked great. Purchsed 2 more tubes and one had a leak, the other had a bad valve. Amazon sent replacement and those were also defective. Ordered 2 more and 1 was good, one had a bad valve. Inconsistent quality. I realy love the first 2 that i received. Have 200 miles on those no problem. I was torn on how to review these tubes but at the end of the day it is about consistency in quality for me. I want to be sure if I need a replacement it will work the first time. Sorry Continental, i really wanted these to work.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Not the size it says.
customer_reviews.text: Product states it fits 700c tire but tube was too large. Was at least 1.5-2” larger in diameter than rim. I selected 700c 32-42 size when ordering and it lists that size on box received but product inside is not that size. When installed and aired up it pops tire out of rim. Trying to return but when I select return it doesn’t give me option to return this item. Contacting Amazon about returning to seller but be weary.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: High failure rate right after tube installation.
customer_reviews.text: 2 out of 3 tubes I purchased were defective. Had a similar experience with these previously so beware of the quality. Both failures occurred right at the first filing after changing to new tires. One tube failed at the stem and the other had a leak in two places on seams. I treated these gently on the installation and have had zero failures using Giant tubes purchase from my local bike store. I ended up reusing my old Giant tube ( with 2k miles) and had no issues so I think I can rule out user error. I am glad I did not depend on these for a flat out on the road. Both tubes could not even be patched.
customer_reviews.author: Dsquared

customer_reviews.title: Good, but CHECK and tighten the valve!
customer_reviews.text: The top of my valve wasn't screwed in properly which lead to a leak after installation. (Not the part you screw/unscrew with your hand, the piece directly below that which screws into the main stem. not sure what it's called). Wasted some time removing the tube checking for holes. Maybe it was a noob mistake... hope this saves somebody some time.
customer_reviews.author: Harvs

customer_reviews.title: Not like the old ones
customer_reviews.text: I have some older tubes, I'm not certain what brand, which have given me years of service. These look the same, but one failed after less than a month. It appears to be failure of the material, as the rubber just split. No hole, no puncture. I'm sorry I cannot recommend them, but I am not convinced there are any better tubes available at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: downhiller

customer_reviews.title: Proper Installation is a Must
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you install them properly. Best to put a little air in them before putting them inside the tire. This will prevent pinching. I learned the hard way and had an immediate blowout.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley West

customer_reviews.title: Holes in tube when product arrived
customer_reviews.text: Tube came with at least 2 holes in it. Tire leaked out air instantly when I attempted to inflate it and install it in a brand new tire. When I sent it back to North State Outfitters, they claimed it was my fault. What? After many emails they refunded my account. 01¢ and sent numerous condescending emails. Do not purchase these tubes!
customer_reviews.author: Get Outside

customer_reviews.title: paper thin
customer_reviews.text: there no way this tube is a brand name tube. after I installed it it didn't even last 24 hrs till it split down the side. I only had 30psi in it, didn't even ride it, changed it out Monday eve and by Tuesday morning after sitting in the garage it was done. it came wrapped in plastic no box no brand at all on the tube. stay away not worth it at all.
customer_reviews.author: alan beede

customer_reviews.title: advertised range is too large
customer_reviews.text: Worked great in my bag for a year, then blew about mile after install. Not debris, not pinch, but suspiciously small diameter. I've never mounted up and taken 40 pumps to build pressure.. there was a lot of slack under my 2.25"
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: My go-to tube
customer_reviews.text: I only buy Conti tubes now. It's weird because I have tried Conti tires on my bike, and on my car, and was not impressed at all. I'll go as far as to say that on my car I was disappointed and did not like them. Their tubes on the other hand have been great. No issues with the valves, no abnormalities. They air up nicely and evenly. They don't deflate too fast. I like them a lot and will not go back to "cheapie" tubes.
customer_reviews.author: mmthrax

customer_reviews.title: These DO have removable valve cores ( good thing)
customer_reviews.text: These are totally tubes! These do have removeable valve cores which allows me to put Stan's liquid in them to prevent flat tires. Works super well.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk

customer_reviews.title: and it will likely last a good while longer
customer_reviews.text: I got a flat tire on my bike, so I ordered a pack of these valve tubes. I was able to change out the flat and install a new tube. This happened several months again and I haven't had any more flat tires since then, which shows reasonable durability of this product already, and it will likely last a good while longer. This product was also offered at a fair price, so I would recommend buying these. Pay attention to what size valve tube your bike has before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: David Tyson

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t hold air
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have had good luck in the past with Continental tubes. Unfortunately the first one I have used loses approximately 40 - 50 pounds of air overnight which means I have to fully pump it up every time I ride. I don’t know about the other two since I have not used them yet. It’s disappointing but it seems harder and harder to find tubes that don’t leak.
customer_reviews.author: J.K.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality flat after 1st ride of 6 miles
customer_reviews.text: I bought two for my road bike with new Gatorskin tires. The one on my front tire got completed flat after my first ride on a paved bike trail. Inflating the tire failed repeatedly and I had to uninstall the tube and tried to find the puncture. But no puncture at all, the leaking is from the air valve itself. Therefore, there is no way to repair. Very disappointed with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Wenge Zhu

customer_reviews.title: Inner tube will not hold air
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed with inner tube. It will not hold air and requires being re-inflated before each use. I would not buy these tubes again. Should have bought them locally as I could do an easy return for a replacement, lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Continental tubes are probably the best you can get
customer_reviews.text: Continental tubes are probably the best you can get. I got a lot of punctures in 2017. The punctures stopped when I switched to these tubes, but who's to say. Anyway these are higher quality than other brands I've bought on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Comqter

customer_reviews.title: Shop here if you want a superior product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, better than expected (valve stem was threaded all the way down, allowing for the locking nut to tighten the tube in the wheel easier). Will be buying from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: David M Golnick

customer_reviews.title: 2 of these came with holes!
customer_reviews.text: Two of these tubes, brand new, came with holes! Not much else to be said.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Had holes when I got them
customer_reviews.text: Two out of two had holes right of of the box and had to be patched—it’d been too long since I bought them by the time I used them to even try to return. Will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Bekah

customer_reviews.title: Quality as expected.
customer_reviews.text: These fit our bike well. Arrived in a timely manner and a descent price. Seems like a durable tube. Time will tell but satisfied at the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Totally worthless
customer_reviews.text: Really poor quality. All three of them busted valve after exactly one bike outing. Complete waste of money. Unfortunately past return as I had kept them as backup.
customer_reviews.author: Common sense

customer_reviews.title: 26" tube
customer_reviews.text: Well made. The valve stem is metal with ring for tightening to rim incase tire is completely flat. Much easier to air up without using needle nose pliers to hold stem in place.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Prentice

customer_reviews.title: Very sensitive innertubes
customer_reviews.text: You have to be EXTREMELY CAREFUL or otherwise you gonna have a flat every day or so.....very BAD QUALITY
customer_reviews.author: JOE

customer_reviews.title: Best tube
customer_reviews.text: After trying a few different brands and styles over the years, this has by far been NY most favorite tube. Will definitely continue to use this tube on my 29er
customer_reviews.author: Stephen S

customer_reviews.title: My first tube change went flawlessly.
customer_reviews.text: This tube worked perfectly on my bike, and it took very little time to do it. It's a bike tube, it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Soto's Honest Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Nice Tube
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made tube. I always keep one with me out on the trail just in case of a flat. It gives me peace of mind. Overall, it’s a good value and it gives you a backup for when you might need it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Works in a pinch. No pun intended
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my own bike but it actually worked for my friend's bike which was the wrong size (27.5+ tubeless) when he got a flat in the woods
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice replacement
customer_reviews.text: Nice item. I like quality of continental nowadays. Good replacement of very thin stock kendra
customer_reviews.author: Maksym

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, feel much thicker than the previous set I bought (tac9 I think) though the valve stem is 32mm not 42mm.
customer_reviews.author: Imortan Bob

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Experience
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. Both tubes had a slow leak. Ended up ordering some “specialized” tubes. Waste of time and money
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the tires, I have been using this brand for both my MTB and route bike, and it has worked well. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Carrera

customer_reviews.title: Top quality tubes
customer_reviews.text: Although not the lightest available, these are top quality tubes. They have a removable valve which is a requirement IMHO as I fill these with sealant after mounting them.
customer_reviews.author: bakerjw

customer_reviews.title: Better than others
customer_reviews.text: My husband said he likes this inner tube better that some of the others he has used on our bikes.
customer_reviews.author: M. C00L3Y

customer_reviews.title: Installed without Issue
customer_reviews.text: Installed together with 700x37 Continental Contact Plus tires on 622x19 rims without tools. Buy the right size tires and tubes for your rims and you should have no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Coker

customer_reviews.title: Fits my wheel and holds air.
customer_reviews.text: Fits my wheel and holds air. That's really about all I can ask of a tube. I've used this brand of tube before with good results so I continue to use it on my two bikes and my wife's bike. So that's six tubes in use on bikes and three spares stored under seats for a total of nine. Guess you could call me a power user of these tubes.
customer_reviews.author: MG - The Jersey Guy

customer_reviews.title: Holds air
customer_reviews.text: What more could you really ask of a tube? They seem to be of higher quality than the Sunlite tubes I've ordered in the past. EDIT: I've been using these for about three weeks and my biggest complaint is that that caps on both the front and back have stripped out. I have to twist them very gently or they just spin and spin. We'll see how long till I lose one.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: After a *terrible* experience with a local bike store that left me with a $8 piece of scrap rubber with cracked valve seal - let me just say: these things were a huge relief. Well priced, and heck if they don't just feel sturdy. Load off my mind
customer_reviews.author: Cf poppa

customer_reviews.title: Because I cannot take away stars!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 of these, now less than 50 miles on them and they are both flat.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: it is what it is
customer_reviews.text: Not much to evaluate here. It is what it is. Its on the bike, and its holding air.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Valve came off stem
customer_reviews.text: Valve came unscrewed from the stem while I was inflating a low tire. I screwed it back in as tight as I could managed, yet it leaked air and would not inflate.
customer_reviews.author: madbull60

customer_reviews.title: Fixed My Tires
customer_reviews.text: Tube is good. Fit my bike. So far no problem after a month.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Mine was a 23 tire and is fits
customer_reviews.text: Came on time hard to get excited it is a bike tube
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Gray

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend these tubes.
customer_reviews.text: Great durability for the price. This is the only tube I use and I have several hundred miles on these tubes.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: I used it with Maxxis Hookworm 26 x 2.5 tires.
customer_reviews.author: mat_919

customer_reviews.title: No orange but it's a tube
customer_reviews.text: As advertised but mine had a black cap (really wanted the orange) and not sure if it's been inflated previously as it contained a small amount of air and the box was kinda destroyed, usually inner tubes are almost vacuum tight on the roll, this wasn't.
customer_reviews.author: Vic

customer_reviews.title: Sweet rubber
customer_reviews.text: Always good to have a nice backup on the trail in case the tubeless takes a hit!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Anderson

customer_reviews.title: It's an innertube.
customer_reviews.text: Works just like every other inner tube I've ever used. It holds air and keeps the tire inflated.
customer_reviews.author: Dickens

customer_reviews.title: Durable and strong
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend. Not flimsy. Strong . Feel confidently that it will last.
customer_reviews.author: EAP

customer_reviews.title: consistent quality
customer_reviews.text: have always had good success with conti tires and tubes. so far it's holding air and fit nicely in my 700x32 tire
customer_reviews.author: Steve P

customer_reviews.title: Seam failed on first inflation
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these along with two new tires. One worked fine, the other tube ruptured at the seam at 40psi the first time I inflated it.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. James Williams

customer_reviews.title: In my case 50/50 chance of getting a defective one.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2, used one. I just now tried to use the second one. It’s defective and past the return deadline. The tube seems to have come out of the mold too skinny around the presta valve. So 1 was good and 1 bad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: These tubes are high quality and at a great price. Considerable flexibility in stem length also. I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: NeilfCars

customer_reviews.title: Won’t fill with air.
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down the worst tire I have ever used on any vehicle in the long history of vehicles I’ve used. Utter garbage. It literally will not fill with air. I think it’s a faulty valve stem or something put it absolutely sucks sheet.
customer_reviews.author: justin enderes

customer_reviews.title: Got Flat on first trip....
customer_reviews.text: On my very first trip after installing this tubes I got a flat tire. I always used cheapest made in china tubes, but this time I wanted to go fancy and see if there was any difference. Well I either got a defective tube, or the cheap tubes are better overall. Just wanted to mention that this happened on pavement, with expensive MTB michelin tires.
customer_reviews.author: Above Skies

customer_reviews.title: Make sure the tube isn't pinched before airing.
customer_reviews.text: I have a steel frame road bike with 700x25c wheels and it fit perfectly just make sure you don't pinch the tube when airing. I did on the first one and it blew up.
customer_reviews.author: Lina Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Best combination of weight cost and quality.
customer_reviews.text: Good inner tube. Less expensive than latex tubes and hold air better. They are slightly heavier than latex. They give a nice ride similar to latex.
customer_reviews.author: D Bear

customer_reviews.title: My order said "3" and I received 3. A steal for < $8. I should have bought more.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what's going on with this item, but when I purchased it on June, 22, 2015 my order said "3 of Continental 60mm presta valve tube, black, 700 x 20-25c", and I received 3 as advertised. The tubes themselves are a bit thick, and weigh about 100gms each. Still $8 for 3 "name brand" tubes is a deal. I should have bought more.
customer_reviews.author: Techie

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy. Had to replace all of them after 1 hour or less of hard riding. Not worth the time and money
customer_reviews.author: christopher c lepak

customer_reviews.title: These tubes are failing constantly now!!!
customer_reviews.text: Conti must have dropped the ball, I have had an 80% fail rate with these, searching for a better brand.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Begert

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised these are presta valve with a removeable core. that seems high quality to me.
customer_reviews.author: Kanes

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment...
customer_reviews.text: Failure on the inside seam at about 90 days after installing.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: No Go.
customer_reviews.text: Goat head puncture on first ride. Valve does not allow you to add sealant to tube.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: Great Reliable Tube
customer_reviews.text: My tires are getting chewed up by debris, but the tube isn't. A lot lighter than the puncture resistant tubes I had on previously so it works for me and the battle of rolling resistance.
customer_reviews.author: Mohawk MikeTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new tube to replace the one I patched twice. This is the correct size as noted per my tire. Fits as expected and I've had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Wrxstiftw

customer_reviews.title: Reinforced rubber at stem caused a little rise in tire ...
customer_reviews.text: Reinforced rubber at stem caused a little rise in tire tube. Appreciate the reinforcement but really should trim the reinforcement. No star take off since worked as promised.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: I recommend it! Have a long tube which is very ...
customer_reviews.text: I've being getting those tubes in other opportunities... I recommend it! Have a long tube which is very important to my bike.
customer_reviews.author: Neyla Bontempo

customer_reviews.title: Nice, even tube
customer_reviews.text: They sent a race bike tube. Lighter, but less durable. Nice, even tube, minimal lines. The bulge by the valve area is more even than other brands. The listing was for a standard tube; I got a race inner tube.
customer_reviews.author: Ruben Rosa

customer_reviews.title: It holds air & works like an inner tube, what else did you think it would do? :-)
customer_reviews.text: It's a bike tube folks. It is rubber, round & holds in air. What sort of review are you expecting? Continental are the higher end manufacturer of tire products, so it should work much better than the cheap knock off brand from China, mine does (been there, done that). I did not get paid, reimbursed, of given anything for free (never do as I am not important enough online!) so you are getting my own unbiased, honest opinion & nothing but that. :-)
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how to review this. They work fine so far.
customer_reviews.author: sandy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tube for the money.
customer_reviews.text: These are a basic item for cyclists and this brand is as good as any. I have had about a half dozen and all have performed as a tube should. The stems are the long ones, but that doesn't matter even though they are not required for my rims. I hope this review has been helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Martin

customer_reviews.title: Fixed my flat on my Continental road tire
customer_reviews.text: I dislike the fact that they are no longer available.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gibbert

customer_reviews.title: Avoid these tubes!!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced 4 bikes with these tires and after two weeks all tires are flat. I should note no miles have been put on these tubes and bikes were hung on the wall after tube replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended tubes, great value and durability
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size tubes for my bike, very durable as well. I have ridden over a 200 miles on them so far and they've held up great on road and off road. Very fast shipping too I was able to get back riding much sooner than expected. Will definitely be purchasing more
customer_reviews.author: Andric

customer_reviews.title: Holds air well!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a total novice and I was able to follow the directions and replace my first tube. I'll buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Steigejg

customer_reviews.title: Get this one, it's the best.
customer_reviews.text: Having used a lot of different brand tubes, these are my favorite. They hold up and keep their air. The threaded design of the stem with stop nut like presta stems seems to prevent getting a separation (and flat). They last longer on my bikes than other tubes.
customer_reviews.author: Ol Terrier

customer_reviews.title: Very light weight  tube, popped
customer_reviews.text: Very thin, for mountain bike applications it is not a good tube. I am not very hard on my equipment and this tube lasted a couple months of light use, then popped during a ride....yes popped. Yes I had slime in it.
customer_reviews.author: Danen C.

customer_reviews.title: Not the the tube shown in the picture
customer_reviews.text: The tube that was delivered was the Cross tube not the Tour tube that was shown in the picture. Cross is a thinner less durable tube. Wanted the heavier Tour tube for long distance gravel rides.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley A Galbraith

customer_reviews.title: Continental need to work on quaility control..50% will be defective with a fault valve
customer_reviews.text: I placed an order for two; One was perfect. The other one the valve just falls out! I cant even fill up the tube without having the valve come out. Continental seriously need to work on quaility control for there products.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: This tube is way better than any store bought tube. Specially made for MTB. I could tell the rubber of the tube is thicker then the tube that came on my bike.
customer_reviews.author: mercurySEVEN

customer_reviews.title: just in case!
customer_reviews.text: got this for my wife's bike - to keep in our road emergency kit. always good to have an extra tube on hand, and you can't go wrong with Continental.
customer_reviews.author: Adam W Mason

customer_reviews.title: Fits Retrospec Mantra V2
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for retrospec mantra v2 bike. 700 X 28C tire size. Fit fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for my 29er
customer_reviews.text: I use these on two different 29ers with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Tube came defective
customer_reviews.text: It was all fine until I tried to change the tube on my bike. This tube came defective and had a hole in it. I was forced to call a very expensive Uber since I was far away from home. Very disappointed with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Anton

customer_reviews.title: Good but can deflate after use
customer_reviews.text: I keep on buying these, can deflate over time and pop
customer_reviews.author: G82G

customer_reviews.title: Always my favorite
customer_reviews.text: I always get Conti tubes - I particularly like the threaded valve stems and the knurled nut to hold it in place.
customer_reviews.author: Brumen

customer_reviews.title: Extra Long Valve for a 25-32cc Tire Tube
customer_reviews.text: I got a Pure Fix bicycle for Christmas. Unfortunately, one of the tire tubes blew out as I accidentally over pumped it. The colored rims on the bike look neat but they're also very deep meaning you need a long valve so it can protrude from the rim and you're able to get a bike pump on it to get air into the tube. This tire tube is the only one that I found on Amazon that fit the specifications and it's worked like a dream since I've had it installed. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: B K

customer_reviews.title: It’s a tube.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a tube. Have used several without issue out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: twowards97

customer_reviews.title: Its more like a 1
customer_reviews.text: Its more like a 1.75" than a 2.5" inner tube- works fine but there's definitely some empty space in side the tire when installing it unless you run the pressure up a bit
customer_reviews.author: Ubique

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality.
customer_reviews.text: The product appears to be what it should be. I like the quality and the valve. I installed it today and works perfect. I bought two so I may have a spare when needed.
customer_reviews.author: idxpert

customer_reviews.title: It's an inner tube
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised. Better when filled with green slime sealant.
customer_reviews.author: spunrubbermat

customer_reviews.title: Working well on Bafang eBike conversion.
customer_reviews.text: I converted a hybrid to an eBike gravel bike and these high the spot on some awesome 16mm road bike rims I had floating around.
customer_reviews.author: New Quilter

customer_reviews.title: Quality Bike Tube
customer_reviews.text: These are great tubes. I have bought a bunch over time. I haven't had any issues with the quality of this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Carlooch

product_meta.title: Continental Bike Tube (26"/27.5"/29"/700)
product_meta.description: Continental Standard Schrader valve tube for size 26x1.75-2.5. Seamless and mold cured construction for added durability. Fits Size 26x1.75-2.5 Seamless, mold-cured manufacturing offers uniform roundness and enhanced reliability at the valve stem 33mm removable Schrader valve Made with a butyl tube compound Threaded
feature_bullets: PREMIUM INNER TUBES - Preferred by champions and riders worldwide
VULCANIZED TUBES- All Continental Tubes are seamless and mold cured to ensure uniform roundness and better reliability at the valve stem.
QUALITY TESTED- Every Continental Tube passes a stringent 100% quality control inspection.
UNITUBE- Continentals Unitube system allows greater compatibility with more tire sizes and less tubes.
REMOVABLE VALVE CORES - Useful for adding extenders or using Revo Sealant.
